sources.title: Cyrano De Bergerac
sources.description: From: IMDb : France, 1640: Cyrano, the charismatic swordsman-poet with the absurd nose, hopelessly loves the beauteous Roxane; she, in turn, confesses to Cyrano her love for the handsome but tongue-tied Christian. The chivalrous Cyrano sets up with Christian an innocent deception, with tragic results. Much cut from the play, but dialogue not rewritten.

The chivalrous Cyrano sets up with Christian an innocent deception, with tragic results. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/cyrano-de-bergerac-1950/

sources.title: Cyrano De Bergerac (1950)
sources.description: Cyrano de Bergerac is a 1950 American adventure comedy film based on the 1897 French alexandrine drama Cyrano de Bergerac by Edmond Rostand. It  follows the story of a talented poet and swordsman, Cyrano, who is deeply in love with his beautiful cousin Roxane but feels unworthy due to his large nose. To help her pursue another man, Christian, who lacks eloquence, Cyrano secretly writes love letters for him, leading to a complex love triangle filled with wit, bravery, and ultimately tragedy. The film  stars José Ferrer as Cyrano, Mala Powers as Roxane, and William Prince as Christian de Neuvillette. Other notable cast members include Morris Carnovsky as Le Bret and Ralph Clanton as Comte de Guiche.

The charismatic swordsman-poet helps another woo the woman he loves, with an Oscar winning performance by José Ferrer.

sources.title: Cyrano de Bergerac (1950) José Ferrer, Mala Powers | A Nose for Romance, a Heart of Valor.
sources.description:
The Most Loved of All Love Stories!
Cyrano, a sharp-witted and eloquent swordsman burdened by deep insecurities over his large nose, secretly helps the handsome but tongue-tied Christian woo the woman they both adore, the clever and radiant Roxane. Through poetic letters and heroic deeds, Cyrano sacrifices his own desires, proving that true love often comes at the price of unspoken heartache.

Original title: Cyrano de Bergerac (1950) 
Black and white version: https://youtu.be/0J0RFoHGFtY


Director: Michael Gordon
Writers: Edmond Rostand, Brian Hooker 
Stars: José Ferrer, Mala Powers, William Prince 
Genre:  Classics, Adventure, Drama, Romance


00:00 Full movie with subtitles
05:21 Cyrano silences the actor Montfleury, commanding him to leave the stage.
47:12 Cyrano reveals his love for Roxane but feels unworthy due to his appearance.
1:14:31 Cyrano and Christian form a pact to combine Cyrano's words and Christian's looks to woo Roxane.
1:33:50 Christian realizes Roxane loves him only for Cyrano's letters and sacrifices himself emotionally.
1:43:29 Roxane, unaware of Cyrano's secret, reads Christian's final letter after his death.
1:50:12 Cyrano, fatally wounded, declares his unyielding independence and poetic spirit.
1:53:00 Cyrano dies standing, sword in hand, as Roxane mourns her lost love.

sources.title: Cyrano De Bergerac ( 1950)  Adventure,  Drama,  Romance
sources.description: Poet, romantic and sword fighter Cyrano de Bergerac (Jose Ferrer) loves the beautiful Roxane (Mala Powers), but although he is proud enough of his bulbous proboscis that he regularly duels those who dare mock it, he fears she could never love a man with such an enormous nose. When he learns that she  loves the handsome guardsman Christian (William Prince), Cyrano provides the tongue-tied young man with the words of love and devotion he wishes he could say to Roxanne himself.
